docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The purpose of this repository is to create a python library to help developers dealing with time-series analysis.

docs.title: Project
docs.text: This library will include several features to deal with different scenarios of time-series analysis: Trend Analysis, Seasonality Detection, Noise, Outliers, Model Selection and Classification.

docs.title: Context
docs.text: This is part of an investigation project executed by FCUP student Francisco Macieira in the context of his Artificial Intelligence and Data Science bachelor, with the help of FCUP and FEUP professor Moisés Santos.

docs.text:

For example:

{
  "error": "Invalid API key"
}

docs.title: Get Started!
docs.text:
Ready to contribute? Here's how to set up EasyTest for local development.

  1. Download a copy of EasyTest locally.

  2. Install EasyTest using poetry:

    $ poetry install

  3. Use git (or similar) to create a branch for local development and make your changes:

    $ git checkout -b name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature

  4. When you're done making changes, check that your changes conform to any code formatting requirements and pass any tests.

  5. Commit your changes and open a pull request.

docs.title: Pull Request Guidelines
docs.text:
Before you submit a pull request, check that it meets these guidelines:

  1. The pull request should include additional tests if appropriate.
  2. If the pull request adds functionality, the docs should be updated.
  3. The pull request should work for all currently supported operating systems and versions of Python.

docs.title: Pelt_Num_Breakpoints
docs.text:
This feature detects the number of points where the trend changes. Low value: The trend has few/none shifting points, and is constant through time. High value: The trend is constantly shifting, provoking many structural changes.

Parameter Type Description Default model str Cost function model (e.g., "l1", "l2", "rbf") "l2" custom_costBaseCost or NoneCustom cost function object. Overrides `model`. None min_size int Minimum allowable segment length. 2 jump int Subsampling step size for checking breakpoints. 5 params dict or None Additional parameters dictionary for the cost `model`.None

docs.title: STL_Trend_Strength
docs.text:
This feature computes the strength of a trend within the time-series. Low value: A value close to zero means there are few/none indicators of a trend in the time series. High value: A value close to one means there are strong signs of the series containing a trend.

Parameter Type Description Default freq int Frequency (period) of the time series (e.g., 12 for monthly). 1 seasonal int Length of the seasonal smoother (must be odd). 7 robust bool Flag for robust fitting. False

docs.title: ACF_FirstLag
docs.text:
This feature measures the first autocorrelation coefficient (lag 1). Low value: A negative value indicates negative autocorrelation (tendency to oscillate). High value: A positive value indicates positive autocorrelation (tendency to persist).

Parameter Type Description Default nlags int Number of lags for ACF calculation. 10

docs.title: CrossingPoints
docs.text:
This feature counts the number of times a time-series crosses the median line. Low value: Means there are few/none oscillations across the time-series. High value: Means there are frequent oscillations across the time-series.

No Parameters

docs.title: LinearRegression_Slope
docs.text:
This feature measures the overall linear trend slope. Low value: A negative value means there is a downward trend. High value: A positive value means an upward trend.

No Parameters

docs.title: LinearRegression_R2
docs.text:
This feature measures how well a linear trend fits the time-series (Coefficient of Determination, $R^2$). Low value: A value close to zero means a linear model explains little variance. High value: A value close to one means a linear model explains much of the variance.

No Parameters

docs.title: EntropyPairs_Value
docs.text:
This feature measures entropy based on the 3 quantile bins of the time-series. Low value: Means simpler patterns in the time-series sequence. High value: Means more complex patterns in the time-series sequence.

No Parameters

docs.title: SpectralEntropy_Value
docs.text:
This feature measures the forceastibility of a time-series. Low value: Means there are strong signs of a trend across the time-series. High value: Means the time-series is probably white-noise.

Parameter Type Description Default sf float Sampling frequency of the time series. (Mandatory) method str PSD calculation method ("welch" or "fft"). "welch" nperseg int or NoneSegment length for Welch method. If None, defaults based on data length.None normalize bool Normalize entropy output to [0, 1]. False

docs.title: HighFluctuation_Value
docs.text:
Measures the proportion of large changes in the time-series. Low value: Means few/none large fluctuations. High value: Means many large fluctuations.

No Parameters

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Requirements

** Core Dependencies The following packages are required to run EasyTest:

  • numpy>=1.23.5

  • pandas>=2.2.1

  • statsmodels>=0.14.0

  • scikit-learn>=1.2.0

  • ruptures

  • matplotlib

** Development Dependencies The following packages are required for development, testing, and linting:

  • pytest>=7.1

  • black>=23.10

  • flake8>=6.1

  • mypy>=1.0
